author: jochembrouwer
content:
Hi all, currently working on fixing our EOF implementation. The test counts seems to have exploded since Iast checked (which is good! ðŸ˜„ )

I am wondering is there any implementation I can use to cross-reference the tests via a trace? This would be incredibly helpful ðŸ™‚

author: _shemnon
content: There are ways to get the traces from all clients, if you know the incantation.  Off hand for geth it is `evm --json statetest <state-test.json>` and for besu `evmtool --json state-test <state-test.json>`.  Geth will need to use my fork (https://github.com/shemnon/go-ethereum/tree/osaka-mega-eof) but for besu you can just use the latest release.

author: jochembrouwer
content: Oh right, I should have known this (our t8ntool implementation does not have trace support yet). Thanks ðŸ˜„

author: jochembrouwer
content: RETURNDATALOAD, is this also applied in legacy contracts?

author: _shemnon
content: No, the old error performs the same in old contracts.

author: jochembrouwer
content:
Hey all, EthJS just passes the blockchain tests in https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/tag/eip7692%40v2.1.0, but only those in `fixtures/blockchain_tests/eip7692_eof_v1`, not those in the `eofwrap` folder (seems to be current tests but now for Osaka (?)) 

The reason is that our Blockchain test runner reports:

`Error: gas limit decreased too much. Gas limit: 68719476736, min gas limit: 99902343750000000 (block header number=1 hash=0xe689ed9c58578625bd227d3a74f1233aab623186d8a137e92613aa8162b65ef9 hf=osaka baseFeePerGas=7)`

If I check a file (for instance `Cancun/stEIP4844-blobtransactions/eof_wrapped_blobhashListBounds3.json`) then genesis block gas limit is `0x016345785d8a0000` but block 1 gas limit is `0x1000000000`, this is not allowed per the max gas limit increase/decrease rule.
